abstract.p: Steve Barnes letter on jokey restaurant menus (S)

block.p: Amanda Hesser's story about jokey or otherwise playful restaurant menus (''The Menu Winks, and Catches the Eye,'' June 28) reminded me of a great meal I had after being stranded in Edmonton, Alberta. A hotel concierge pointed me toward a remarkable restaurant called the Hardware Grill. The menu featured plenty of the lengthy ingredient lists to which Ms. Hesser rightly objects (''Pan-Seared Prince Edward Island Scallops, Wrapped in Applewood Bacon, with Brandade Galette, Chanterelle Emulsion and Roasted Pepper Butter,'' for example). But the two briefest were also pleasantly punchy: ''Soup of Yesterday'' and ''Sure, We have a Green Salad! With House Vinaigrette.''
